types.description: A runtime variable that can hold multiple primitive data types

associationRoles.description: Defined on RuntimeVariable → Machine. Creates: RuntimeVariable.Machine (the machine this variable belongs to) and Machine.RuntimeVariables (all runtime variables for this machine)

attributes.description: Boolean value of the runtime variable
DateTime value of the runtime variable
Double precision floating point value of the runtime variable
The IEC 61131-3 data type of the runtime variable in the SCADA system
64-bit integer value of the runtime variable
Integer value of the runtime variable
String value of the runtime variable
Tag or VariableName that is used (when available) that generated this event
TimeSpan value of the runtime variable

values.name: Undefined
values.description: No priority has been assigned to the alarm.

values.name: Low
values.description: The alarm is of low priority.

values.name: Medium
values.description: The alarm is of medium priority.

values.name: High
values.description: The alarm is of high priority.

values.name: Critical
values.description: The alarm is of critical priority.

enums.description: The priority of an alarm is a measure of its importance relative to other alarms. The priority of an alarm is used to determine the order in which alarms are presented to the operator.

values.name: Undefined
values.description: No source has been assigned to the alarm.

values.name: FieldDevice
values.description: The alarm is generated by a field device.

values.name: ControlSystem
values.description: The alarm is generated by a control system.

values.name: HMI
values.description: The alarm is generated by a human-machine interface.

values.name: Internal
values.description: The alarm is generated by an internal source.

enums.description: The source of an alarm is the entity that is responsible for the alarm.

values.name: Undefined
values.description: No state has been assigned to the alarm.

values.name: Normal
values.description: The normal state should not use an audible indication. The normal state visual indication should be the same as indications without alarms.

values.name: Unacknowledged
values.description: The unacknowledged alarm state should use both an audible indication and visual indication. The audible indication should be silenced with a silence action or acknowledge action by the operator. The visual indication should be clearly distinguishable from the normal state indication by using colours and symbols (e.g., shape or text). The visual indication for an unacknowledged alarm should include a blinking element. There are some environments in which an audible indication is not an effective indicator of unacknowledged alarms.

values.name: Acknowledged
values.description: The acknowledged alarm state should not use an audible indication. The acknowledged alarm state visual indication should be clearly distinguishable from the normal state indication by using symbols (e.g., shape or text), and should be identical in colour to the unacknowledged alarm indication. A blinking element should not be used in the visual indication for an acknowledged alarm.

values.name: ReturnToNormal
values.description: The return-to-normal unacknowledged state should not use an audible indication. The return to-normal unacknowledged state visual indication may be the same as the normal state or it may indicate an unacknowledged status with a blinking element.

values.name: Shelved
values.description: The shelved alarm state should be visually indicated in the HMI. The visual indication for a shelved alarm should not include a blinking element. The shelved alarm state indication should be distinct. No audible indication should be used to identify shelved alarms.

values.name: SuppressedByDesign
values.description: The suppressed-by-design alarm state should be visually indicated in the HMI. The visual indication for an alarm suppressed by design should not include a blinking element. The suppressed-by-design alarm state indication should be distinct from the unacknowledged and acknowledged state indications. No audible indication should be used to identify alarms suppressed by design.

values.name: OutOfService
values.description: The out-of-service alarm state should be visually indicated in the HMI. The visual indication for an out-of-service alarm should not include a blinking element. The out-of-service alarm state indication should be distinct from the unacknowledged and acknowledged state indications. No audible indication should be used to identify out-of-service alarms.

enums.description: The state of an alarm is a measure of the alarm's current status.

values.name: Undefined
values.description: No type has been assigned to the alarm.

values.name: Absolute
values.description: The alarm is based on an absolute value.

values.name: Deviation
values.description: The alarm is based on a deviation from a set-point.

values.name: RateOfChange
values.description: The alarm is based on the rate of change of a value.

values.name: Discrepancy
values.description: The alarm is based on a discrepancy between two values.

values.name: Calculated
values.description: The alarm is based on a calculated value.

values.name: RecipeDriven
values.description: The alarm is based on a recipe-driven value.

values.name: BitPattern
values.description: The alarm is based on a bit pattern.

values.name: ControllerOutput
values.description: The alarm is based on a controller output.

values.name: SystemDiagnostic
values.description: The alarm is based on a system diagnostic.

values.name: InstrumentDiagnostic
values.description: The alarm is based on an instrument diagnostic.

values.name: Adjustable
values.description: The alarm is based on an adjustable value.

values.name: Adaptive
values.description: The alarm is based on an adaptive value.

values.name: ReAlarming
values.description: The alarm is based on a re-alarming value.

values.name: Statistical
values.description: The alarm is based on a statistical value.

values.name: FirstOut
values.description: The alarm is based on a first-out value.

values.name: BadMeasurement
values.description: The alarm is based on a bad measurement.

enums.description: The type of an alarm is a measure of the nature of the alarm.

values.name: INT
values.description: IEC_INT - 16Bit signed

values.name: UINT
values.description: IEC_UINT - 16Bit unsigned

values.name: DINT
values.description: IEC_DINT - 32Bit signed

values.name: UDINT
values.description: IEC_UDINT - 32Bit unsigned

values.name: REAL
values.description: IEC_REAL - 32Bit float

values.name: LREAL
values.description: IEC_LREAL - 64Bit float

values.name: BOOL
values.description: IEC_BOOL - 1Bit

values.name: USINT
values.description: IEC_USINT - 8Bit unsigned

values.name: SINT
values.description: IEC_SINT - 8Bit signed

values.name: STRING
values.description: IEC_STRING - 8Bit*n

values.name: TIME
values.description: IEC_TIME

values.name: DATE
values.description: IEC_DATE

values.name: TOD
values.description: IEC_TOD - Time of Day

values.name: DT
values.description: IEC_DT - Date and Time

values.name: WSTRING
values.description: IEC_WSTRING - 16Bit*n

values.name: BYTE
values.description: IEC_BYTE - 8Bit

values.name: WORD
values.description: IEC_WORD - 16Bit

values.name: DWORD
values.description: IEC_DWORD - 32Bit

values.name: LWORD
values.description: IEC_LWORD - 64Bit

values.name: LINT
values.description: IEC_LINT - 64Bit signed

values.name: ULINT
values.description: IEC_ULINT - 64Bit unsigned

enums.description: IEC 61131-3 data types for SCADA runtime variables (zenon compatible)
